Initiates, oversees and audits Shop and Shop Inspector.

Write and develop Weld procedures and can sign ASME Level III procedures.

Both New Tank and Repair.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Construction Manager Land Development

Location: Houston, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Description

Manage construction implementation process for land development and drainage projects from start to final closeout.Periodically observe construction work in-progress at job sites.knowledge of contracts, schedules, drawings, estimates and specifications to ensure relation and compliance to project requirements.Obtain, maintain, and manage data, information, communications, and approvals required by the project and company between engineers, owner’s contractors/subcontractors, or other project related entities.Coordinate, direct and monitor the activities of contractors/subcontractors, engineers, and related performing entities.Manage project controls, cost, and performance activities and procedures.Lead in project meetings to include documentation, administration and tracking of relevant information and statuses.Manage construction to ensure the project is in accordance with the design, budget and schedule. Includes interfacing with client representatives, engineers, vendors, subcontractors, governmental representatives, etc.Maintain official project log and documentation files.Provide direction on planning, CPM scheduling, and engineering functions as required.Responsible for obtaining signatures for contracts, processing pay estimates and change orders, coordinating inspections and pre-construction meetings.Coordinate with appropriate City or County entities for acceptance of constructed facilities.

Requirements

Bachelor of Science degree in Civil Engineering or Construction Management.Professional Engineer license is a plus.4 years’ experience with construction means and methods for land development projects.Must possess some familiarity with construction estimating, cost, project controls, CPM scheduling, documentation, engineering and construction principles, techniques, materials applications and practices.Experience with land development design is a plus.Proximity to Texas City would be ideal but not required.Strong computer skills and familiarity with Microsoft products, and experience with project related systems such as Procore, Microsoft Project. The ability to apply experience in areas of accounting, cost control, administrative and personnel interaction in a professional environment.Capable of building and maintaining relationships with clients, contractors, government representatives and others.Successful candidates will apply good organizational skills and take charge of overall coordination between multiple contractors within master plan land development communities.

Quiddity is an award-winning, full-service civil engineering, planning, surveying, and consulting firm. With more than 600 employees in 10 offices across Texas, our organization has 14 service groups that support nearly 16 public and private markets. Remaining true to our mission has helped us be consistently voted a Best Place to Work by local and regional publications and an Engineering News-Record Top 150 National Firm.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis under applicable law.

NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES: Quiddity does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Quiddity. Without a signed Recruitment Fee Agreement, Quiddity will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. Suppose a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement. In that case, Quiddity explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency.

Benefits

Quiddity's benefits include Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, Life, 401K with matching, paid Holidays, plus Paid Time Off.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
